title: GeoZarr
text:
What is Zarr?
An community developed, open-source format for the storage of chunked, compressed, N-dimensional arrays

Cloud optimized (concurrent read/writes, ‚Äúinfinitely‚Äù scalable)
Cross-disciplinary (originally developed for bio-imaging)
Extremely extensible (supports any key-value store)


Find out more at https://zarr.dev

title: GeoZarr
text:
What‚Äôs going on today?

Zarr is growing in popularity
Icechunk is improving consistency and performance
VirtualiZarr is simplifying virtualization
Progressing towards Zarr specification V3 across languages

title: GeoZarr
text:
Zarr implementation landscape

Independently implemented across languages

Zarr Python 3.0 released in January
Even Rouault is updating GDAL‚Äôs Zarr driver
Lachlan Deakin is updating the Zarrs Rust library
Trevor Manz was (is?) trying to consolidate the JavaScript implementations (unaware of format 3 status)
Unidata has build Zarr support into the NetCDF C library (unaware of format 3 status)
OpenScapes is coordinating R support (will rely on GDAL driver)
Unaware of Julia lang‚Äôs progress towards Zarr format 3



Read more about Zarr-Python, Icechunk (from Earthmover), and VirtualiZarr (community developed, created by Tom Nicholas).
